medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was admitted with midepigastric pain that has been persistent and described as constant, nonradiating, and sharp. The pain is associated with nausea and has not improved with food. The patient has taken oxycodone, TUMS, and NSAIDs without relief. Previous similar pain improved with narcotic therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes pancreatic adenocarcinoma status post Whipple procedure, post-surgical pain syndrome, bipolar disorder, and depression.
medical_history.family_history: Father had an MI. No family history of pancreatic disease or cystic fibrosis.
